Restores depth, clarity, and color accuracy
Prepares paint for long-term ceramic or PPF protection
features: Paint depth & defect assessment with lighting

whatItIs.description: Paint correction uses abrasives and machine polishers to safely level microscopic defects in your clear coat. Unlike glazes or fillers, true correction removes defects rather than hiding them, revealing crisp reflections and maximum gloss.
benefits: Permanent removal of many light-to-moderate defects
Significantly reduced haze and improved reflectivity
Creates a pristine surface that maximizes coating/PPF bond

items.a: Many light-to-moderate defects can be permanently reduced or removed. Deep scratches through the clear coat may require touch-up or refinishing.

items.q: Is clear coat safe during correction?
items.a: Yes—our approach uses measured, minimal removal and test-spot dialing to preserve clear coat while achieving visible improvement.

items.q: Do I need ceramic coating after correction?
items.a: Highly recommended. Coatings help preserve results, add hydrophobics, and simplify maintenance. Sealants are also available.
Typically 4–8 hours for 1-Stage, 8–14 hours for 2-Stage, and 1–2+ days for intensive multi-stage work, depending on condition.
